LiverFunctionTests.Name: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT)
LiverFunctionTests.About: An enzyme found in the liver that helps convert proteins into energy for the liver cells. Elevated levels can indicate liver damage.

CausesEffects.HighALT: Liver disease, hepatitis, cirrhosis, and fatty liver disease.
CausesEffects.LowALT: Generally not a concern but may indicate malnutrition or other health issues.

Foods.Dos: Eat a balanced diet with plenty of fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and whole grains.
Foods.Donts: Avoid alcohol, excessive sugar, and fatty foods.

Exercises.Dos: Engage in regular moderate exercise like walking, swimming, and cycling.
Exercises.Donts: Avoid strenuous activities that can cause fatigue and stress on the liver.

LiverFunctionTests.Name: Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST)
LiverFunctionTests.About: An enzyme found in the liver and heart. Elevated levels can indicate liver damage or other health issues.

CausesEffects.HighAST: Liver disease, heart problems, muscle damage, and pancreatitis.

Foods.Dos: Consume antioxidant-rich foods like berries, nuts, and green leafy vegetables.
Foods.Donts: Avoid alcohol and processed foods high in fat and sugar.

Exercises.Dos: Regular light to moderate exercise such as walking, yoga, and swimming.
Exercises.Donts: Avoid high-intensity workouts that can stress the muscles and liver.

LiverFunctionTests.Name: Alkaline Phosphatase (ALP)
LiverFunctionTests.About: An enzyme related to the bile ducts; often increased when they are blocked.

CausesEffects.HighALP: Liver disease, bile duct obstruction, and bone disorders.

Foods.Dos: Eat foods rich in vitamin D and calcium such as dairy products, fish, and fortified cereals.
Foods.Donts: Avoid excessive alcohol and foods high in trans fats.

Exercises.Dos: Weight-bearing exercises like walking and resistance training to support bone health.
Exercises.Donts: Avoid overly strenuous activities that can lead to injury or stress.

LiverFunctionTests.Name: Bilirubin
LiverFunctionTests.About: A substance produced during the normal breakdown of red blood cells. High levels may indicate liver or bile duct problems.

CausesEffects.HighBilirubin: Liver disease, bile duct blockage, hemolytic anemia.

Foods.Dos: Stay hydrated and eat fiber-rich foods like fruits, vegetables, and whole grains.
Foods.Donts: Avoid alcohol and fatty foods that can overwork the liver.

Exercises.Dos: Regular moderate exercise such as walking, cycling, and swimming.
Exercises.Donts: Avoid high-impact exercises if jaundice or other symptoms are present.

LiverFunctionTests.Name: Albumin
LiverFunctionTests.About: A protein made by the liver, important for maintaining the osmotic pressure needed for proper distribution of body fluids.

CausesEffects.LowAlbumin: Liver disease, kidney disease, malnutrition, or inflammation.

Foods.Dos: Consume adequate protein through lean meats, dairy, legumes, and nuts.
Foods.Donts: Avoid excessive alcohol and processed foods.

Exercises.Dos: Engage in regular physical activity to maintain overall health.
Exercises.Donts: Avoid extreme diets or over-exercising, which can affect protein levels.

LiverFunctionTests.Name: Gamma-Glutamyl Transferase (GGT)
LiverFunctionTests.About: An enzyme involved in the transfer of amino acids and peptides across the cellular membrane. Elevated levels may indicate liver or bile duct issues.

CausesEffects.HighGGT: Liver disease, bile duct problems, excessive alcohol consumption.

Foods.Dos: Eat a diet rich in antioxidants and low in fat, such as fruits, vegetables, and whole grains.
Foods.Donts: Avoid alcohol, fried foods, and high-sugar snacks.

Exercises.Dos: Incorporate regular moderate exercise like walking, yoga, and swimming.
Exercises.Donts: Avoid heavy lifting and intense workouts if liver problems are present.
